title: Getting started
text: twinning package includes functions importing moose twinning data producing twinning rate estimates, plots summary tables, MS Word report follows USFWS Refuge graphic standard. package originally developed moose twinning surveys Tetlin National Wildlife Refuge, functions flexible adapted moose twinning surveys elsewhere.

title: Getting started
text: use twinning generate reports, ’ll need: R version >4.0 Available FWS Apps--Go Rtools version >4.0 Available FWS Apps--Go version RStudio includes Quarto install twinning:
code: if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools")   devtools::install_github("USFWS/twinning",                           ref = "main",                           build_vignettes = TRUE)   library(twinning)

title: Getting started
text: find help file function twinning, type ? name function. example, get help use import_format() function, type ?import_format.

title: Getting started
text: two general approaches using twinning selecting approach take depends needs. first approach (“step-wise”), consists using individual functions work steps importing formatting input data, performing analysis, creating tables plots. approach favored ’re interested examining details analysis, like perform additional analyses included package, just want tables figures. second approach (“one”) performs steps compiles results PDF report run_report() function. approach favored annual reporting results. details two approaches.

previous_headings: How do I use it? > Option 1: Creating figures and tables
what: Step 1: Import and format data using import_format()
title: Getting started
text: first step using functions twinning import format data. done using import_format() function, takes CSV data returns formatted R data frame. function requires file directory path CSV containing properly formatted data. input CSV following standard described metadata. use example data follow required standard:
code: dat <- import_format(system.file("extdata", "dat.csv",                                   package = "twinning")) head(dat) #>     srvy_day leafout group latitude longitude bull yrlcow cow0clf cow1clf #> 1 2021-05-29      60     1 63.23780 -142.8996    0      0       0       1 #> 2 2021-05-29      60    10       NA        NA    0      0       5       0 #> 3 2021-05-29      60    11 63.07439 -142.9055    0      0       2       0 #> 4 2021-05-29      60    12 63.04049 -142.7978    0      0       0       1 #> 5 2021-05-29      60    13       NA        NA    1      0       0       0 #> 6 2021-05-29      60    14       NA        NA    1      0       0       0 #>   cow2clf cow3clf       pilot       observer nabevw #> 1       0       0 Leif Wilson Bryce Woodruff   West #> 2       0       0 Leif Wilson Bryce Woodruff   East #> 3       0       0 Leif Wilson Bryce Woodruff   West #> 4       0       0 Leif Wilson Bryce Woodruff   West #> 5       0       0 Leif Wilson Bryce Woodruff   East #> 6       0       0 Leif Wilson Bryce Woodruff   East

what: Step 3: Create summary tables and figures
title: Getting started
text: can create formatted flextable tables figures report: Year Bulls Cow moose Totala Yearlings calf One calf Twins Triplets 2021 58 18 66 25 6 0 173 2022 109 18 86 29 7 0 249 2023 46 5 40 31 1 0 123 2024 58 2 35 24 7 0 126 Total 271 43 227 109 21 0 671 aTotal adults yearlings; include calves; Year n Twinning rate SE 90% CI 2021 31 0.19 0.072 0.077--0.31 2022 36 0.19 0.067 0.086--0.303 2023 32 0.03 0.031 0--0.082 2024 31 0.23 0.076 0.102--0.349 Overall multiyear 130 0.16 0.032 0.108--0.215 Eastern multiyear 32 0.31 0.083 0.178--0.447 Western multiyear 98 0.11 0.032 0.06--0.165 can also create summary plots:
code: tbls <- create_tbls(dat) tbls$tbl1 tbls$tbl2 figs <- create_figs(dat) figs$fig2 figs$fig3

title: Getting started
text: function developed generate Quarto report summarizes annual moose twinning results. relies many functions importing, formatting, analyzing, generating tables figures. run function, simply run: addition saving MS Word doc report working directory, function also creates new directory (default name quarto) working directory contains .qmd file used render report associated files, including bib files bibliography, csl file formatting bibliography Journal Wildlife Management standard, images folder, MS Word doc file containing custom text styles match National Wildlife Refuge System graphic standard. files can edited needed, .qmd can re-rendered directly customize report, needed.

text: McCrea Cobb. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cobb M (2025). twinning: Creates MS Word report moose twinning. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {twinning: Creates a MS Word report of moose twinning},   author = {McCrea Cobb},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: An R package for reporting on moose twinning rates
text: R package imports moose twinning data, estimates twinning rates, generates plots summary tables, produces survey report. Originally developed Tetlin National Wildlife Refuge’s moose twinning survey, adopted similar surveys. Generates report follows AK Refuge Report Series template.

title: An R package for reporting on moose twinning rates
text: use twinning generate reports, ’ll need: R version >4.0 Available FWS Apps--Go Rtools version >4.0 Available FWS Apps--Go version RStudio includes Quarto install twinning:
code: if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools")   devtools::install_github("USFWS/twinning", ref = "main", build_vignettes = TRUE)    library(twinning)
